benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods - Retrieve account payment methods

covered: Valid Request: Multiple happy-path scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07, TC20, TC21) validate expected 200 responses and response shapes for various query parameter combinations.
Empty Response: TC08 verifies behavior when an account has no payment methods (empty JSON array with 200).

Query Parameters: Extensive coverage of query params including withPluginInfo, includedDeleted, pluginProperty, audit (FULL/MINIMAL), invalid audit value, extra/unexpected params, combination of params (TC02-TC07, TC12, TC13).
Error Handling: Invalid accountId format (TC10), non-existent account (TC09), service unavailable (TC15), and timeout/network (TC16) are covered.
Security: Injection/XSS checks for accountId and pluginProperty (TC17, TC18).
Authentication: Missing authentication token case covered (TC11) leading to 401.
Edge / Scale / Resilience: Large dataset performance (TC14), transient dependency failure and retry (TC19), integration with plugin service failure (TC22).
Regression & Compatibility: Regression and backward-compatibility checks included (TC20, TC21).
gaps: Pagination: No test verifies pagination behavior or limits/offsets when result sets are large (the standard guidelines call out pagination explicitly).
Caching Behavior / HTTP semantics: No scenarios validate caching headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GET behavior.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests that exercise rate limits or behavior under many rapid requests (429 handling).
Authorization nuances: Only missing-token (401) is tested — there are no tests for insufficient permissions/forbidden (403) or role-based access control.
Response Contract details: While shape is asserted, there are no explicit schema/field-level validations (required fields, types, content-type header, or malformed PaymentMethod objects).
Pagination performance trade-offs: While TC14 checks large number of records and response time, it does not verify server-side pagination or memory/streaming implications.
Caching + Plugin failures interplay: No tests that combine withPluginInfo=true and plugin-service failures beyond generic 502/503 behavior verification depth.
Rate-limiting + auth interplay: No tests to show behavior when requests exceed rate-limit while authenticated/unauthenticated.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: verify limit/offset or page-based behavior, boundary conditions (page=0, page beyond end), and consistent ordering across pages.
Add caching/HTTP semantics tests: verify presence and correctness of Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified headers and conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since) responses (304).
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to confirm 429 responses and retry-after headers, and confirm graceful degradation.
Expand authorization tests: include 403 Forbidden cases where credentials are valid but lack required permissions, and tests for expired/invalid tokens vs revoked tokens.
Add schema/field-level validation: assert PaymentMethod fields, types, required properties, content-type header (application/json), and behavior when individual payment method objects are malformed.
Combine failure modes: create scenarios mixing withPluginInfo=true and plugin-service partial failures to validate partial data, proper error codes, and observable diagnostics.
Add caching and plugin interplay: test whether pluginInfo responses are cacheable and whether ETag/Cache-Control vary when withPluginInfo toggles.

Extend performance tests: verify response times under realistic load and confirm whether server paginates automatically or returns all items; if it returns all, ensure memory usage/timeout considerations are tested.
